theoryText: Aokiji's (Kuzan's) association with the Marines was anchored in a deep-rooted desire to safeguard both Ohara and the concealed truths of the Void Century and the Ancient Kingdom. His compassionate decision to spare young Nico Robin and create an ice path for her escape suggests he disagreed with the World Government's actions and has been working from within to protect the truth.
author: Various One Piece theorists

source.title: One Piece: The Tragedy Of Ohara, Explained

theoryText: Oda may have hinted at Robin being of Lunarian descent during her flashback. Nico Olvia has silver-white hair and brown skin just like the Lunarians. Additionally, Olvia's wanted poster features fire in the background, similar to how Lunarians are depicted. This could explain why the World Government was so interested in Ohara and Robin specifically.
author: Various One Piece theorists

source.title: One Piece: Nico Robin's Demon Awakening May Have Revealed Her True Heritage

theoryTitle: The Books of Ohara Will Be Destroyed Again
theoryText: After Saul and the giants recovered the books thrown into the lake and brought them to Elbaf, recent manga developments suggest the World Government's Holy Knights may destroy these books again. Their true goal involves threatening to destroy Elbaf's schools and libraries, including the Owl Library that houses Ohara's salvaged research. This would represent the final erasure of Ohara's legacy.
author: Various manga readers

source.title: One Piece May Take Away the Biggest Key to the Void Century

theoryTitle: Professor Clover Knew the Name 'Joy Boy'
theoryText: When Professor Clover was about to reveal the name of the ancient kingdom before being shot, many theorists believe he was going to say 'The Kingdom of Joy Boy' or similar. This connects to later revelations about Joy Boy being a key figure from the Void Century. The Five Elders' panic at preventing him from speaking the name suggests it's something that could unravel their entire narrative.
author: One Piece community

theoryTitle: Monkey D. Dragon's Revolutionary Army Was Inspired by Ohara
theoryText: It's revealed that Monkey D. Dragon visited the ruins of Ohara after its destruction and was so moved by the World Government's atrocity that he decided to form the Revolutionary Army. The destruction of Ohara and the suppression of truth became the catalyst for Dragon's rebellion against the World Government.
author: Confirmed in manga
